Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: POROUS INTERVAL IDENTIFIER: Code uniquely identifying each porous interval inincrements. It allows the user to store information on multiple porous intervals.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AVERAGE POROSITY: Value of the average porosity for the porous interval.
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the porous interval.
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.7: BASE TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: True vertical depth measured straight down fromthe surface to the base of the porous interval.
Column Comment.8: BASE TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH OUOM: Base true vertical depth original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.9: CORE LENGTH: Measured length of the core sample from the porous interval.
Column Comment.10: CORE LENGTH OUOM: Core length original unit of measure.
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.13: GAS SHOW: Y(es) or N(o) indicating a show of gas in the porous interval.
Column Comment.14: GROSS THICKNESS: Value for the measured vertical thickness from the top of thehighest permeable zone in the interval to the base of the lowest permeable zone inthe interval.
Column Comment.15: GROSS THICKNESS OUOM: Gross thickness original unit of measure.
Column Comment.16: NET THICKNESS: Value for the gross measured vertical permeable thickness minusthe impermeable zones in the interval.
Column Comment.17: NET THICKNESS OUOM: Net thickness original unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: OIL SHOW: Y(es) or N(o) indicating an oil show in the porous interval.
Column Comment.19: POROSITY CUTOFF: The minimum porosity used to qualify the interval.
Column Comment.20: POROSITY QUALITY: Standard quality indicators describing the porosity of theinterval. For example poor, good, very good or excellent.
Column Comment.21: POROSITY TYPE: A description of the type of porosity observed. For exampleintergranular, sucrosic or cavernous.
Column Comment.22: AGE CODE: Code identifying the formation age associated with the porous interval.
Column Comment.23: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.24: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: STRATIGRAPHIC AGE: the name of the geologic age, such as Triassic, Jurassic,Quaternary Pleistocene, Tertiary Pliocene. The value will NOT be absolute geologicage in millions of years (125,000 mya) .
Column Comment.27: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.28: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.29: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the porous interval.
Column Comment.30: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.31: TRUE VERTICAL TOP DEPTH: True vertical depth measured straight down from thesurface to the top of the porous interval.
Column Comment.32: TOP TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH OUOM: Top true vertical depth original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.33: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.34: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.35: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.36: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.37: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.38: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.39: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
